definition: purple qipao gown, the sign of an official position

sentences.english: A prince in royal purple upon a couch of ease?
sentences.chinese: 是一個穿紫袍，享受安樂的王子嗎？

sentences.english: And they clothed him with purple, and platted a crown of thorns, and put it about his head
sentences.chinese: 他們給他穿上紫袍，又用荊棘編作冠冕給他戴上。

sentences.english: Purple robes are an emblem of authority and rank.
sentences.chinese: 紫袍是權力和等級的象徵。

sentences.english: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns, and put it on his head, and they put on him a purple robe
sentences.chinese: 兵丁用荊棘編作冠冕，戴在他頭上，給他穿上紫袍。

sentences.english: The soldiers twisted together a crown of thorns and put it on his head.
sentences.chinese: 兵丁用荊棘編作冠冕，戴在他頭上，給他穿上紫袍。

definition: black (without gloss)/black with a hint of red in it
black clothes/servant (old)/young woman role in Chinese opera, also called 正旦[zheng4 dan4]
honored sir (a person of higher status or seniority, or a Buddhist monk)
official robe worn by ministers during the Ming 明 (1368-1644) and Qing 清 (1644-1911) dynasties
